description: A chef is a professional cook and tradesman who is proficient in all aspects of food preparation, often focusing on a particular cuisine. The word chef is derived from the term chef de cuisine the director or head of a kitchen.

ingredients: 2 regular size boneless chicken breasts, washed and finely chopped
cookingMethod: 1. Marinate the chicken with ginger, garlic, garam masala and lime juice. Keep aside for 2 hours (can also be marinated overnight, or in the morning to fry in the afternoon/evening, in that case, add lime juice a few hours before frying).
2. Add the salt, green chilli, cilantro and onions (if desired) and mix.
1. Cut the meat into small pieces, wash and drain properly.
2. Wash and drain potatoes. Mix with some salt and a pinch of turmeric powder or alternatively saffron powder for color.
Now heat oil in a pan. Deep fry the potatoes till brown. Strain the potatoes to remove extra oil and set aside.
1. Cut the meat into small pieces, wash and drain properly.
2. Wash and drain potatoes. Mix with some salt and a pinch of turmeric powder or alternatively saffron powder for color.
Now heat oil in a pan. Deep fry the potatoes till brown. Strain the potatoes to remove extra oil and set aside.
